item.title: Vim: Learnings so far
item.description: I’ve been using Vim instead of RubyMine for the last month or so and it’s been interesting observing the way that I browse code as I add plugins to make my life easier. Between files I generally don’t know exactly where in the folder structure different files live since I’m used to being able to search by just the name i.e. RubyMine’s Ctrl-N Yahuda Katz wrote a blog post earlier in the year where he listed some of the plugins he’s been using - one of which is called Command-T and allows exactly this functionality.
